Ad Text:
Enterprise ownership of performance, reward and people insights
Direct influence on Executive and Board decision-making
$250,000 - $280,000 salary package depending on experience (hybrid working)
This CBD based, purpose driven insurance organisation has an influential opportunity for an experienced people‑leader to shape the future of performance, reward, and workforce insights and create and embed programs that will drive a high-performance culture. This role plays a pivotal part in strengthening organisational capability, driving evidence‑based decision‑making, and ensuring robust governance across all performance and remuneration frameworks.

About the Role
Reporting to the GM of Employee Experience and partnering with stakeholders including P&C Business Partners and executive team members, you will lead a small team comprising a Reward Manager and 2 Analysts.  You will be accountable for designing, developing, implementing and managing the performance, reward and accountability strategy for the enterprise for Board approval.  You will also play a key role in enabling the business to apply a consistent and rigorous framework to meet strategy, performance & compliance requirements.  Some of your activities will include:

End‑to‑end reward management, including performance frameworks, remuneration cycles, and policy governance
Leadership of analytics, insights, and reporting, ensuring accuracy, clarity, and strategic value
Partner with senior leaders and P&C business partners translating complex data into meaningful insights that inform executive decision‑making and organisational strategy
Oversee optimisation of people & workforce metrics and dashboards to track and visualise KPI’s.
Oversee development and presentation of key metrics to evaluate People Experience delivery and compliance with proactive auditing, exception reporting and operational metric development & deployment.
Research and prepare Board papers on remuneration and performance matters.
About You
Tertiary qualified, you are a seasoned remuneration professional and will bring a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and strong judgement. You are experienced with people analytics and data governance and can demonstrate where you have used date to drive decisions and change behaviours.  While direct experience in governance and Board reporting is highly valued, the organisation is also open to exceptional candidates who demonstrate capability, maturity, and the potential to step into this level of responsibility.

If you enjoy working in purpose‑driven environments and are seeking a remuneration role that has a change orientation and are motivated by the opportunity to influence outcomes at the highest levels, please contact either Julie Amato on 02 8256 2572, or Merridy Thomas on 02 8256 2543, quoting reference number 4006194, for a confidential discussion or click the link below.

About Perilya Limited

Perilya Limited is a well-established Australian mining company with a proud history and a strong international footprint. Our operations include the iconic Broken Hill Operation in New South Wales - one of the world’s great base metals mines with over 130 years of continuous production, and Coridom in the Dominican Republic, the country’s first underground mining operation, which continues to deliver high-quality zinc, lead, copper, and silver.

Together, these assets form the foundation of a business with scale, resilience, and long-term growth opportunities.

Perilya is recognised for its commitment to operational excellence, safety leadership, and environmental responsibility. We invest in our people and communities, fostering diversity and creating genuine career pathways across both corporate and operational sites. Our collaborative culture values integrity, accountability, and continuous improvement, making Perilya a workplace where talented people can thrive and contribute to a sustainable future in mining.

Role Details

Perilya is seeking an experienced Data Architect to lead the design and evolution of our enterprise data landscape. This is a hands-on role responsible for shaping data strategy, setting architectural standards, and enabling data-driven decision-making across a complex, multi-site mining operation.

You will act as the technical authority for all data-related architecture, governance, and platforms, while providing leadership and guidance to our Data Engineer and Data Analyst.

As the Data Architect, you will be accountable for the end-to-end design, integrity, and scalability of Perilya’s data ecosystem. You will work closely with business and IT stakeholders to ensure data is secure, trusted, and fit for purpose - supporting operational efficiency, reporting, and strategic initiatives across Australia and internationally.

Be advised this is a 6-month contract, based in our Adelaide Head Office.

What You’ll Be Doing

Data Architecture & Strategy

Design and maintain enterprise data architecture, including data models, data warehouses, data lakes, and pipelines

Develop and manage a long-term data roadmap aligned to business strategy

Establish and enforce data governance frameworks covering data quality, lineage, security, and compliance

Define architectural standards and best practices across the organisation

Technical Leadership

Act as the subject matter expert for data platforms, tools, and technologies

Evaluate and recommend new technologies to improve data management and analytics capability

Provide technical leadership and mentoring to Data Engineering and Analytics team members

Collaboration & Delivery

Translate business requirements into effective data architecture solutions

Partner with Data Engineers to ensure robust, scalable data pipelines

Work with Data Analysts to optimise data for reporting and analytics platforms such as Power BI

Technology Oversight

Oversee implementation of new data solutions as part of major IT initiatives

Ensure all data solutions comply with security, regulatory, and governance requirements

Proactively identify and mitigate architectural risks affecting performance or data integrity

Data Culture & Communication

Clearly communicate architectural decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Champion a data-driven culture across the business

What You Will Bring

You are a strategic thinker with deep technical expertise who enjoys influencing, mentoring, and building sustainable data solutions in a complex operating environment.

Key Skills & Capabilities

Strong enterprise data architecture and system design capability

Strategic mindset with the ability to align data solutions to long-term business goals

Advanced problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

Proven leadership and stakeholder engagement experience

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly

Adaptable and comfortable working with evolving technologies

Qualifications & Experience

Essential

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field

10+ years’ experience in data engineering, data warehousing, or similar roles

At least 5 years’ experience in a senior Data Architect role

Proven delivery of end-to-end data solutions on a major cloud platform (preferably Microsoft Azure)

Expert knowledge of data modelling, database technologies, and ETL/ELT principles

Strong experience in data governance, security, and compliance

Desirable

Microsoft Azure certifications or equivalent

Experience in mining or industrial environments

Exposure to Big Data technologies such as Databricks or Spark

Why Join Perilya

Influential role with enterprise-wide impact

Opportunity to shape and mature a data strategy from the ground up

Exposure to complex, global operations

Supportive and collaborative IT leadership environment

How to Apply

To be considered for this role, please submit a brief covering letter and CV by following the APPLY NOW prompts.

At Perilya Limited, we value diversity and inclusion, strongly encouraging applications from women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, and candidates from culturally diverse backgrounds.

We are committed to building an inclusive workforce where everyone can contribute, grow, and succeed.

Initial 14 month contract + possible extension
Brisbane (Kelvin Grove)
Hybrid and flexible working available

In collaboration with a leading higher education provider, Emanate Technology is looking for a Salesforce-savvy Principal Business Analyst to shape and deliver a large-scale enterprise Digital Engagement Platform. This is a hands-on role where your Salesforce expertise and strategic analysis skills will turn complex business ideas into meaningful learner and partner engagement outcomes.

What you’ll be doing
Scoping business improvement initiatives into analysis activities
Leading end-to-end business and solution analysis
Partnering with business, program and technical stakeholders
Translating needs into solution specifications and user stories
Facilitating workshops with diverse stakeholder groups
Mapping current, transitional and future-state processes and data
Evaluating inputs to inform solution design decisions
Consolidating information for feasibility and option assessments
Advising non-technical audiences in plain language
Supporting system, integration and UAT testing
Contributing to change, training and adoption artefacts

What you need to bring
A proven track record delivering Salesforce-based business analysis
Strong capability implementing enterprise platforms at scale
A systems-thinking mindset focused on customer outcomes
Demonstrated strength building stakeholder relationships
Hands-on application of best-practice analysis techniques
Clear evidence of traceability from problem to solution
Confidence operating within complex, multi-project environments

Bonus points for…
Background delivering CRM solutions in government or education
Exposure to delivering large-scale digital engagement platforms
Involvement in delivering change and adoption initiatives

For a confidential discussion, or for more information please contact Amy Watson on 0405 965 866 or amy@emanatetechnology.com.au.

#SCR-amy-watson-1


We are an inclusive employer committed to fostering a diverse and accessible workplace. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, people of all ages, and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

Job Description


Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where and how you can work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney, and we strongly prefer a hybrid approach based in Sydney.

About the team

Our People (HR) Programs Team act as the conduit between our broader People Group and our internal partners across IT, Procurement, Finance, Legal and Security to deliver on our People Technology goals. People Programs partners with our People Systems team to centrally own and sequence our People tech roadmap, rallying everyone towards a big-picture, cross-team vision for our tech.  

About the role

The Workday HR Systems Analyst plays a crucial role in executing configuration, managing operational health, and enabling automation across Canva’s core Workday modules - Core HCM, Advanced Compensation, Employee Voice (Engagement), and Performance Management.

This role sits at the heart of Canva’s tiered People Technology operating model:

Tier 1 (People Ops) handles frontline support and basic configuration.

Tier 2 (People Tech / You) delivers safe, business-led configuration of medium-complexity changes, leads testing, and partners with IT.

Tier 3 (IT / Technical System Owners) manages complex integrations, custom development, platform architecture, and compliance.

As a Tier 2 operator, you’ll configure and test safe changes within Workday, triage and troubleshoot issues, and partner with the People Ops team and IT to keep our platform stable and continuously improving. You’ll also lead the review, redesign, and optimisation of end-to-end workflows in Workday to reduce friction, remove unnecessary steps, and align with Canva’s evolving ways of working.

What you’d be doing in this role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

Keeping Workday running smoothly: Configure and maintain Workday business processes, condition rules, security groups, time off rules, and org structure, and module-specific features within Core HCM, Advanced Compensation, Employee Voice (Engagement), and Performance.  Own user role assignments and audit access controls in partnership with IT. Plan, design, and execute end-to-end testing cycles for Workday changes, including unit testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT). Develop and maintain reusable test scripts and scenarios to ensure consistency across releases. Partner with People Ops and IT to coordinate integration testing, UAT, gather feedback, and resolve defects before deployment.
Automate and elevate processes: Identify manual or repetitive HR workflows and build automations using low-code tools like Workato to redesigning core business processes (e.g., onboarding, job changes, offboarding, approvals) to be more user-friendly, compliant, and efficient.
Be the first responder: Act as the Tier 2 contact for Workday-related issues raised by People Ops or escalated from Tier 1. Conduct root cause analysis and document known issues and fixes. Escalate complex technical or infrastructure issues to IT (Tier 3) when needed.
Maintain clean, compliant data and deliver actionable insights: Execute and validate bulk data changes (e.g., manager changes, org restructures, location updates). Ensure changes for compensation cycles, performance processes, or other events are accurately reflected in Workday and free from errors. Partner with People Ops to prevent downstream data quality issues and maintain compliance with policies and regulations. Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics in Workday to provide actionable insights for stakeholders.
Liaise with vendors and partners: Raise and track support tickets with Workday or third-party vendors. Work closely with IT to support Workday platform upgrades and regression testing. Maintain documentation for configuration history, data mapping, and change impact assessments.
Enable self-service and readiness: Create engaging, easy-to-follow guides, knowledge articles, videos, or in-system prompts for Canva users and People Ops teams. Support testing and change communications for Workday feature releases.
Improve over time: Proactively map current-state workflows, identify pain points, and propose future-state designs that improve efficiency, compliance, and user experience. Participate in roadmap planning with Product Owners to prioritise changes that improve scale, accuracy, and usability. Contribute to building AI- and automation-enabled system capabilities that support operational excellence.

You're probably a match if you

Enterprise SaaS experience: You’ve configured, supported, or maintained complex platforms, including Workday within medium to large enterprise environments with global footprints.

Workday know-how: Comfortable navigating Workday modules. Core HCM and Advanced Compensation essential. Bonus for other modules such as Employee Voice (Engagement), and Performance Management , BP frameworks, supervisory orgs, and access roles.

Workflow design skills: Ability to assess, redesign, and implement business processes that enhance system usability and operational efficiency.

Problem-solving mindset: You’re comfortable triaging and resolving system issues and understand how to apply safe-change practices.

Automation confidence: You’ve worked with low-code tools like Workato (or similar) and can build simple to moderately complex flows.

Data fluency: Confident working with large datasets, validating accuracy, and ensuring changes don’t break downstream reporting.

Cross-functional communicator: Able to explain configuration choices to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

AI curious: Interested in experimenting with smart tools and AI agents that can augment user experience or reduce human workload.

Bias for action: You move things forward, solve problems, and take ownership of your space in the system landscape.

What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too

Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers

An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more

Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.
